headline.main: A Soda Company Struggles to Whet A Town's Interest

docs.abstract: Article on controversy over decision to replace Hosmer Mountain soda vending machine with Coca-Cola machine at Willimantic Midget Football League field in Willamantic, Conn; decision sparked protest march and resolution by Board of Selectmen to support home-grown businesses; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: HOSMER MOUNTAIN soda, with its 30 flavors, is popular among many residents and workers in Willimantic. The superintendent of schools is partial to the root beer. The deputy fire chief likes the diet cola. First Selectman Michael Paulhus said his favorite is strawberry. As for the rest of the Paulhus family, almost any flavor will do. The family has been drinking the soda for three generations.
